description: This course introduces the philosophical and scientific foundations of professional
nursing.  Students examine historical foundations of the nursing profession and
scientific processes and frameworks underlying nursing theory and practice.
Exploration of concepts in the nursing discipline builds knowledge and
understanding essential to the provision of holistic patient care across the lifespan.
Emphasis is on development of professionalism, use of critical thinking, and
the fall semester. Prerequisites: open to sophomore nursing majors only; concurrent enrollment
